context: Is this game enjoyable to play as a single player game?
response: It's alright as a single player. I didn't enjoy it as much as I did the first one though. I got bored about a third of the way through and quit playing. I think if I had co-oped it I would have stuck with it longer.

context: How good is the mic quality compared to the PC 360's?
response: I own both headsets and they both use the same technology for the Microphone. I use it to record audio and if I had to choose between the two I would pick the 360 by very close margin. hope this helps. But honestly, you cant go wrong with either headset.

context: Oh. So no special tools needed. But I have one more question, will the custom fan (Tailsmoon Wisper Fan) be a problem with the casing?
response: Not at all. I put one in it myself. The whisper fans are the same size and shape as the stock fan.

context: Can you play the Tomodachi Life on a regular Nintendo DS?
response: GameCube VS Wii right here. Tomodachi Life is a 3DS game, which is not compatible with the Nintendo DS. Sorry, you'll have to upgrade to the current system if you want to play it. There's also a Japanese only version called Tomodachi Collection for the original DS, just make sure yours isn't region locked or it won't run either.

context: How does this stand up to jumping? I tend to be a jumper when I'm playing, and i was wondering if this is going to slip?
response: Because this is one of the thicker pads, it stands up to jumping quite well. The bottom is not slick. It's like a foam-ish material that offers some resistance to slipping. I prefer these thicker foam pads to the flimsy thin ones.

context: Is it possible to use one set of headphones with an XBox 360, PS3, PS4, and XBox 1?
response: Practically, no. however if you really wanted to make it work you could: 1) move all 5 systems close together2) then get an Optical Switch that supports up to 5 inputs and has one optical output (if it exist)3) finally connect the output to the transmitterif your not willing to do the above, then "no"

context: How well does the microphone pick up noise from the keyboard? I use a blue switch mechanical keyboard.

context: can i download it again if i erase it
